cvrfdoc.document_title: Red Hat Security Advisory: String format vulnerability in icecast

reference.description: Thanks to |CyRaX| <cyrax@pkcrew.org> for finding the problem and posting it
reference.url: Thanks to |CyRaX| <cyrax@pkcrew.org> for finding the problem and posting it

reference.description: to Bugtraq. For more information please see
reference.url: to Bugtraq. For more information please see

remediation.description:
For each RPM for your particular architecture, run:
rpm -Fvh [filename]
where filename is the name of the RPM.

note: A remote vulnerablity allows execution of arbitrary code.

A string format vulnerability that allows the execution of arbitrary
commands exists in all versions of icecast. A patch was posted to Bugtraq
to solve the problem and has been incorporated into this update. All users
of icecast should apply this update.
